direction.raw_text: NIGHT - (2003) The night is stillborn. Without sound or movement and nothing is in definition. All we see are degrees of blackness in this unlit world. The vague impressions of an African village in the void... a ragged line of tukuls (straw huts)... a bicycle propped against a mud wall... a soccer ball in the dirt...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And we find a Sudanese family asleep on reed mats. A mother, father and their two boys. The younger boy we'll come to know as "WILLIAM" (9). His older brother "CHRISTOPHER" (12) curled next to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And slowly the blackness begins to shift... an otherworldly light seeping in from someplace far off... shadows contorting in a ghostly orange flicker... images emerging... the silhouettes of men coming into this village carrying flaming torches.

direction.raw_text: The family still sound asleep, oblivious to the torch glow coming from outside, and suddenly -- SCREAMING! -- GUNSHOTS! The family bolts awake, moving to their feet as the door to their tukul SLAMS open -- THREE soldiers from the Lord's Resistance Army (LRA) coming in carrying AK47's -- shouting in Arabic -- "Get up! Get up!" -- the FATHER stepping forward -- holding up his hands -- "Don't shoot!" -- KAK! KAK! KAK! And he's gunned down in cold blood. The soldiers grab the mother and boys and begin to drag them out of the tukul -- but WILLIAM breaks free -- scrambles deeper into the room -- THE SOLDIER going after him -- WILLIAM darting behind a stack of storage boxes knocking them to the ground -- frantically burrowing into the corner -- trying to get away but it's useless -- THE SOLDIER grabs his feet and begins to pull him out -- WILLIAM KICKING WILDLY -- digging his nails into the dirt -- and as he's dragged out of the corner he reaches out... inadvertently grabs a FADED PHOTOGRAPH which has fallen on the ground...

direction.raw_text: Jackie, gimme a mash and bud... (TO SAM) You want somethin? Sam shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know that old Indian didn't die out there that night. Story in the Lehigh Valley News bout it. Somebody picked that poor bastard up after us, took him to the emergency room, you believe that shit?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God was lookin out for us both, I suppose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: slides a shot and beer in front of Donnie...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well then, here's to him. (DRINKS) Didn't hear you pull up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got Lynn's car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She broke down on ya?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sold her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ahhh, shit, man. Shoulda come to yer ole buddy first. Donnie smiling, inviting him back into this world. And we're watching Sam, threshold moment here, considering.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CHILDERS MOBILE HOME - NIGHT It's late and we see Lynn sitting at the kitchen table alone. Sam has not come home and she is clearly worried. And then we hear a car pulling up outside, door opening and closing, and Sam coming into the trailer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry I'm late.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lynn staring at him, trying to read this man's face but he's not looking at her. Avoiding her gaze. Did he use? Is he high? And then she sees a PINPRICK OF DRIED BLOOD on his shirtsleeve. Her face contorting almost imperceptibly. Her worst fear realized. Relapse. And she moves to him without saying a word... lifts up his arm and unbuttons the cuff of his shirt... slowly pushing up his shirtsleeve to discover a NEEDLE PRICK in his arm... ... and then he pulls out a $20 bill and hands it to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gave blood over in Pitt. Lynn searching his eyes and she knows he's telling the truth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's all I got. And she pulls him close, hugging him tight, grateful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Somethin will come through. I promise. And we hold on Sam, his troubled eyes. Completely out of options. And we see that for this man the inability to provide for his family is crushing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! -- FLASHES OF LIGHTENING! -- a storm starting to batter the trailer park.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CHILDERS MOBILE HOME - NIGHT Lynn in front of the TV, scared, watching an EMERGENCY WEATHER WARNING... winds buffeting the trailer... Sam coming into the room from the back...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two touched down near Harrisberg.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CHILDERS MOBILE HOME - NIGHT Sam opening the door, coming down the steps, looking up to the sky and it is fucking black, swirling, ominous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CHILDERS MOBILE HOME - NIGHT Sam coming back into the trailer fast -- SAM Come on! Let's go... Lynn following him -- 20 INT. HALLWAY - CHILDERS MOBILE HOME - NIGHT -- down the hallway -- WIND PICKING UP -- starting to rock the trailer back and forth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get Paige, grab a blanket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lynn darting into a bedroom, scooping Paige out of her bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MOBILE HOME - NIGHT Sam coming in, moving to a metal gun locker in the corner of the room, pulling out a SHOTGUN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MOBILE HOME - NIGHT THE WIND -- SLAMMING the trailer now -- Lynn and Paige -- terrified - - watching as Sam moves to the center of the room, points the barrel of the shotgun toward the floor and -- BOOM! BOOM! BOOM! BOOM! Blows four gaping holes in the floorboards, then starts to kick through the wood with his boot -- LYNN (yelling, over the wind) What are you doing?! He kicks a hole in the planks, turns to Lynn and Paige -- SAM GET IN! Paige crawling through the opening... into a shallow trench underneath the trailer... Lynn squeezing in behind her... Sam staying outside... no room for him... the trailer starting to buck
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: in the tempest... thin walls contorting around him... ... and Paige starts to cry -- terrified -- Sam laying down on the floor next to the opening, close enough so she can hear his voice...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bug, you hear me?! -- Bug?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. And he starts to play a child's word association game with her... something she knows... something they've played before...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm thinkin of a snail... you hear me, Bug?! Snail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And we hear her tiny little voice say...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whale.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good job, Bug, good job! You said whale, I'm thinkin of a pail!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said pail, I'm thinkin of a tail. And so this little game goes between father and daughter... Paige listening to his voice... in the midst of this terrible storm... somehow becoming less terrified.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A brilliantly clear day and we see neighbors picking up after the storm. Sam on a ladder leaning against the trailer, nailing down a strip of bent aluminum as a pickup truck pulls up. Window rolls down and we see it's the CONTRACTOR from before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Billy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tried to ring ya but your phones down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yep. Sam climbs down, moves to the truck, shakes his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks like ya made it through pretty good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're alright.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn twister touched down eight places between here and Noblesville. Chewed up six hundred homes in Fulton County alone. (BEAT) Got all the work you can handle if you're interested.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm interested... Sam, seizing an opportunity here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I'm puttin my own crew together. We go 50/50 on the jobs. You cover any heavy machines I need.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: til you pay me back on the tools. Then we'll go half.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got a deal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of Lynn carefully applying a vinyl application on the side of a new (but used) truck that reads, "Childers Construction Company"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DAY - (JULY/2000) C.U. ON lynn's closed eyes -- smiling -- LYNN What are you doin, Sam Childers? Months later and we're with Lynn and Paige, their eyes shut, as Sam leads them both by the hand...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wanna peek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep em closed. Sam finally stops them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ok. Open em up. They do and both of their eyes go wide with surprise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are we?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're home, little girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: to see a modest two bedroom house at the end of this driveway. Their new home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's ours?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure is. Go check it out. Paige sprints for the house as Lynn hugs Sam, softly starts to cry into his shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's beautiful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The first night in their new home and we see a few unpacked moving boxes here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Paige sound asleep on a small bed upstairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lynn in the kitchen organizing the cabinets. And Sam enters carrying a box, sets it on the counter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's everything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You get what's in the trunk?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yep. Lynn looking up, seeing how dirty Sam is from the move...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lord, you're filthy, Sam Childers. Lynn tossing him a kitchen towel. Sam, smiling mischievously...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who you callin filthy, woman?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You dirtier than I am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No I ain't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes you are. I seen it. C'mon, girl, gimme a little shake...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam winking at her and playfully snapping a kitchen towel at her butt... Lynn giggling and scooting away...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I ain't doin that no more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... just a little somethin for yer old man, c'mon... And he snaps her butt again but she grabs the towel and snaps him back...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Owww!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You gimme a little shake... She snaps him again and he feels the sting...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: C'mon, Lynn... She snaps him again but he grabs her and they fall into each other against the counter... laughing... and he kisses her... playful at first and then it becomes more passionate... and just as it starts to lead somewhere we go...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DAY - (AUGUST/2002) Two years later and we're watching a congregation finish a Sunday hymn. Sam, Lynn, Daisy, and Paige (10) in the crowd listening to Pastor Krause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Today we are blessed with a special guest. It's my pleasure to welcome Pastor Relling from the Kilangire Christian Ministry in Uganda, Africa. Pastor... Polite applause as a tall, white South African man named PAUL RELLING steps up to the pulpit, and in a deep Afrikaner accent he
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you Pastor Krause, and thank you brothers and sisters for inviting me into this house of the Lord. (BEAT) I'm here today to talk to you about your Christian brothers and sisters, families just like yours, a half a world away that desperately need your help... And we see Sam in this sea of faces, listening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOYER - CHURCH - DAY Parishioners slowly filing out of the church after service. Lynn, Paige, and a few other women chatting by the entrance. And now Lynn looks over her shoulder and sees Sam talking with Paul Relling off to the side, just the two of them in a corner, deep in discussion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The first thing we notice is the relative "opulence" of this place... deep shag, new color TV, matching sectional sofa... the rural idea of making it. Sam, Lynn, Daisy and Paige at the dinner table eating. Sam in his own world, oblivious to the MINOR CONVERSATION until -- LYNN Paige, go get some more beans. Paige heads to the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you thinking?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thinking about Africa. Paige comes back in carrying the beans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They have tigers over there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They eat people!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about Africa?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just thinkin bout that fella today.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He talked funny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just from a different place than us, baby, that's all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was thinkin maybe I'd go over there. Help em out fer a few weeks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Africa?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To see the tigers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was talkin about puttin box beam roofs on school houses over there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about finishing that job in Boswell?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll only be gone a few weeks. Be back before you know it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two weeks later and we're in the rural countryside outside Kampala, Uganda. Sam on the roof of a bombed out school building with other white VOLUNTEERS, working. Sam looks below to see a dozen black men dressed in the ragged fatigues of the Sudanese People's Liberation Army (SPLA). Each is carrying an AK 47 and standing guard at various points around this compound. The lead soldier is a man named DENG. ANGLE three others we'll come to know as "NINETEEN", "MARCO" and "A.J."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's later and we see Deng sitting underneath an awning by himself, working on his machine gun. Sam approaches...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You Ugandan Army or what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sudanese People's Liberation Army. We are freedom fighters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Name's Sam Childers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am Deng. There is a certain reserved nobility in this man, in the way he carries himself and speaks. An unwavering strength and self-reliance born from a lifetime of war and struggle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (re: Deng's weapon) Givin ya problems?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. A bit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Double-feed?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sometimes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lemme have a look... Deng hesitates, then hands his AK over to Sam who pops the mag out and studies it...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yer mag is tight. See here... (INDICATING) The loads are feedin right to the barrel face. That's yer problem... Sam pulls out a knife and begins to work on the base plate of the mag as he explains...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... you need this plate to ramp into the chamber... that way yer brass won't get stuck... (FINISHING) ... there ya go, should be better... And Sam hands the weapon back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No problem.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you military?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, not me. I ain't the military type. Ain't so good with bein told what to do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When did you learn about weapons? Sam considers the question for a moment... then simply says...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Long time ago. Different life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fifteen or twenty volunteers lounging on cots in this dorm, playing cards, talking, smoking. And we find Sam off from the group, on his bunk, reading The Bible...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Hey Childers... Sam turns to find a British man in his late 20's named DAN standing next to him, thick Cockney accent, smoking a cigarette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some of us are going into Kampala tomorrow night. Find ourselves a little fun this weekend. You in?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was thinkin bout goin up north.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You crazy? There's a civil war going on up there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's mid-day, blazing hot, and we see Sam approaching Deng.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Deng, you wanna Coke? Sam offers him a can and he takes it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got a question for ya.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wanna go into Sudan this weekend. Need someone to show me around. You interested?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The others are going into Kampala.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That ain't my speed no more. I wanna see some country. Deng looks at him, surprised by the request...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want to see?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A dirt road cutting through grassy plain stretching in every direction... and we see a BRIGHT YELLOW BUS speeding toward us in the distance, kicking a rooster tail of dust high into the air... and as it gets closer we see 15 or 20 men piled onto the roof, hanging on for dear life as this bus bounces over the road...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Sam and Deng crammed into this crowded bus...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They always drive this fast?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Traveling is the most dangerous time in Sudan. If the rebels find you on the open road it would be very bad. An awkward silence as Deng stares out the window. Sam wanting to connect here, but Deng is reticent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got kids, Deng?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I have no children.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where you from?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A little village called Aweil. Many hours from here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's where your family is? And Deng simply says...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My family was killed by LRA. (BEAT) Unyama is about two hours from here. We will stop there for lunch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deng turns and looks out the window again, silent, quietly watching the land blur past. And Sam says nothing more, intuitively feeling this man's need to be alone in the moment. A great, lost giant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A dense sea of people. 20,000 displaced refugees living on top of each other. Life is lived out in the open here... women bent over brightly colored washtubs sloshing clothes in soapy water... smoke from giant cooking pots drifting into the air... semi-clothed children, some with even younger children on their hips, running everywhere. The poverty and hopelessness is overwhelming. And we see Sam and Deng walking through the camp...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Muslim North has tried to kill the Christian South for 30 years. Two million have lost their lives... Deng sweeping his hand, indicating the mass of refugees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... these people have been driven from their villages, however these camps are not much better...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A row of wood sheds and worn nylon tents marks the hospital area. Each enclosure jammed with the desperately sick. Battle-weary AID WORKERS move among them, doing what they can, caring for the ones who are most desperately ill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cholera and Malaria are everywhere, there is little food and not enough UN soldiers to protect everyone. Even here they worry the LRA will attack at night. And another SPLA soldier comes up to Deng -- SPLA SOLDIER 1 (ARABIC) Are you from Kitgum?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Someone wants to speak with you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deng turns to Sam...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry, Sam... I'll be five minutes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Course, do what you gotta do. Deng leaves and now Sam is completely alone, taking in this mire of humanity all around him. And suddenly there's COMMOTION! -- two aid workers coming into this tent carrying a WOMAN on a stretcher. One of the aid workers looking around -- a white woman -- mid 30's -- her name is AGNETE CLOSSON, Regional Director of Doctors Without Borders. She sees Sam across the tent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me. You. Can you help please? Sam moving to her -- AGNETE (CONT'D) We need to transfer her to the bed. Get her shoulders... Sam grabbing the woman underneath the shoulders as another aid worker gets her feet...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One, two, three... And they swing the woman over to a cot... but as they do the sheer piece of blood-stained muslin that was covering her face falls away... and we see that she has been mutilated... her lips cut off of her face... ... and now a DOCTOR sweeps into the tent and begins to work on her. Sam and Agnete pushed back, away from the action. Sam still shocked by what he's seen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened to her face?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The rebels cut off her lips because she argued. These are Kony's orders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's Kony? Agnete, suddenly suspicious, takes an appraising look of Sam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who are you with?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm with Deng over there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What organization are you with?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Working with a Christian group down South. Just up here takin a look around, seein a bit of the country.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This isn't a tourist destination, this is a war zone. You stay in this area, you'll be killed. (BEAT) Thank you for your help. And she walks off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Establishing a bustling trading center on the border of Uganda and Sudan. Noisy and overpopulated, a maze of concrete and tin buildings, hundreds of people on the streets, riding bicycles, finishing their business before nightfall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A stale room with two cots, bare, institutional. Deng on the edge of his cot, pulling off his boots, taking off his jacket, getting comfortable. And we see Sam sitting on a small balcony overlooking the empty street below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some say Joseph Kony is a wizard. A shapeshifter. He calls himself a Christian... He pulls a baggy of tobacco from his pocket and begins to roll a cigarette...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... but I say he is Satan, who devours his own people.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kony is the leader of the LRA?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is the one we have been fighting for years. But there is very little we can do. Our weapons are old, and our boots are full of holes. We have been forgotten by the rest of the world. And now Deng turns to Sam...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why are you here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: S'cuse me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you looking for in this place?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ain't lookin for nuthin. Deng staring at him, skeptical...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And then you will get your picture and go back to your life and all this will just be a story you tell your friends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HOTEL - NIMULE, SUDAN - NIGHT Sam has no response... and Deng lights his cigarette... and suddenly we hear voices... through the open window... children's voices... Sam peering into the darkness but seeing nothing... only empty streets... and then one-by-one... out of the darkness like apparitions... we see children coming up the street carrying bedrolls... some of them singing spiritual hymns as they walk... laughing as children do... at first just a dozen or so... and then more... fifty... a hundred...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deng steps onto the balcony next to Sam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They are night commuters. They come from deep in the bush. Their parents send them out because it is safer to sleep here than in their own homes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because death comes at night in the villages and refugee camps. And we continue to watch this great migration of children... now streaming into this town... a few of them finding a dark corner just below us... unrolling their reed mats... huddling up against each other for the long night...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These are the lucky one so far. The ones the rebels have not found. The invisible children.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam watching them for another beat then suddenly turning, moving back into the room...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are you going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam coming down these steps. Deng following.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam exiting the hotel, moving to a group of 5 children huddled on the sidewalk...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get up... let's go... The children looking up, surprised to see a white man here...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on... The children getting to their feet... and Sam moves to another cluster of children up the block as Deng catches up to him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They ain't sleepin out here. Tell em they're comin inside. (to children on the ground) Ya'll get up... let's go... And Sam starts to move up the block further, wanting to gather up more children, but Deng stops him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam, there are too many... And he looks up the street and we see more children here than we thought... hundreds of young kids huddled on the streets...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... you can't help them all. Sam knows he's right. A moment here as he looks to the children he's gathered, staring up at him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can help these here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HOTEL ROOM - NIMULE, SUDAN - NIGHT -- and a DOZEN CHILDREN are ushered into this small room. Sam pushing their cots against a wall so there's more space. Deng speaking to the children -- DENG (ARABIC) Settle down... it's alright... you can sleep here till morning...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and they begin to settle onto the floor... and now we notice a particular BOY in this group... maybe 8 years old... wearing bright
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... and we watch as he and his SISTER move to a corner of the room and unroll their mats... ... and eventually Sam turns off the lamp and we stay here in the dark... Sam on his cot, listening to these 12 little children breathing... their shifting bodies on the floor trying to get comfortable... and then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam's closed eyes... sound asleep... Just before dawn. Deng standing over him, shaking him awake...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The LRA attacked a village last night. Sam looking up to him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said you wanted to see. Sam sits up, looks around the hotel room and we see that it's empty... the children vanished... only a small, handmade toy on the ground which has been left behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam, Deng, and a few other SPLA SOLDIERS jammed into the flatbed of this truck, carrying heavy weapons, bouncing fast over this open dirt road... featureless savanna FADING into sporadic mud huts... the outskirts of a VILLAGE in the distance... and thin columns of black smoke twisting into the air... ... and as the truck gets closer to the village we begin to pass
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: walking along the side of the road... night commuters returning to their village... some of them huddled together, weeping...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... and we notice -- Sam notices -- the little boy in the GREEN SHORTS, walking hand-in-hand with his sister, their faces quiet masks of fear as they move closer to their home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The pickup arrives and Sam, Deng, and the other soldiers hop out... and this is what they see: Complete devastation. 30 or 40 bodies mutilated and stacked outside smoking tukuls. Some children already here, on their knees, weeping next to the corpses of their parents. If you could smell the air it would smell of burnt flesh and death. Sam silent, aghast, just staring at the horror all around him... ... and now we see GREEN SHORTS and his sister arriving at the village... moving to their family's tukul and discovering their mother and father piled outside. Naked and burned alive. And the sister falls onto her mother's corpse and begins to wail as GREEN SHORTS stands there -- frozen -- staring down at his dead parents -- and suddenly -- MOVEMENT! -- from inside the tukul... a small dog... a family pet... darting into the open... running across the dirt... GREEN SHORTS going after it, yelling his name... Sam watching the boy chasing after his dog, rounding a corner out of sight... ... for a moment... ... just the boy's voice calling after his dog... and then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! A muffled burst -- in the distance -- Sam, Deng, and the other soldiers running out of the village toward the explosion...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Sam, Deng, and the others arriving at the source of the explosion. CHILDREN'S ORPHANAGE - NIGHT Rebels swarming around the chapel, but reaching a point where they can't advance any further -- -- and we see a rebel squat behind a shed and screw an RPG into a launcher -- he pops up -- levels the launcher at the chapel and -- Krakakakakak! He's cut down before he's able to fire -- INT. CHAPEL - CHILDREN'S ORPHANAGE - NIGHT -- Sam sweeping his AK across the compound -- the other soldiers burning through magazines and reloading -- rebels firing back -- Betty and the children crowded on the floor in the middle of this

direction.raw_text: and we stay in this little chapel -- watching this last stand -- until we -- CUT TO:

direction.raw_text: And we see the entire orphanage has been razed to the ground. Betty and a few of the children picking through the burned out buildings and torched tukuls, looking for anything salvageable. Deng, Nineteen, and some of the SPLA soldiers loading the corpses of rebels into the back of the truck... ... and now we find Sam staring at the brick chapel in the middle of the compound. The only structure that remains. Everything else -- his entire dream -- in ashes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . - NIGHT And we see Lynn pushing a shopping cart down the aisle, past shelves loaded with packaged produce. And we hear BUZZING. Lynn digging the cell phone out of her purse -- LYNN Hello?

direction.raw_text: And we find Sam sitting at a table along this dusty, crowded street. His duffelbag on the ground next to him.

direction.raw_text: It's me.

direction.raw_text: . - NIGHT Lynn immediately senses something wrong.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You ok?

direction.raw_text: And we see that he's not. This man is empty, alone, defeated.

direction.raw_text: They burned it to the ground. All of it. Ain't nuthin left.

direction.raw_text: . - NIGHT She hears the anguish in his voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nimule...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . - NIGHT SAM'S VOICE (O.S.) ... I'm comin home. And we're watching her here, clocking the resignation in his voice. A moment of quiet for both of them. Lynn sensing the dimensions of his heartache. All she wants to do is bring him home, hold him close, ease his pain... but she knows that's not what he needs... not this man...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Sam?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Can you hear me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can hear you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . - NIGHT And we see her move around a corner into an empty aisle, away from the other shoppers. And she says...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then quit feelin sorry for yerself. Them children have had their whole lives burned to the ground and worse. How many of them you see givin up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And we watch Sam listening, finding strength in what this woman says next...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) God gave you purpose, Sam Childers. Now stop yer cryin, get off yer butt and build it again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Giving us a sense that many months are passing.

direction.raw_text: The remainder of the bamboo fence that once surrounded the orphanage being torn down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nineteen, Marco, A.J. and a few other SPLA soldiers cutting the bush away from the edge of the compound with machetes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cut it all down... so they got nowhere to hide...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam, Deng and the crew of village men digging post holes around the perimeter of the orphanage...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How far?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All the way around...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The men sinking metal beams into the holes with cement, then surrounding the compound with heavy gage CHAINLINK FENCE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: New DORMS being built from brick. An INFIRMARY. A MESS HALL.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . And finally, Sam laying the last brick on the chapel in the center of the compound. Completing it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A simple administrative office with a short-wave radio and sat phone. Sam here, sitting at a desk when we hear a knock at the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on in... The door opens and we see Deng.

direction.raw_text: Preacher, you need to come see this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam following Deng to the center of the compound where we see 5 or 6 camp women (including Betty and Rose) dressed in colorful robes and headdresses. Maybe 80 children here, quietly sitting in the dirt, watching the women. Nineteen, Marco, A.J. and the rest of the SPLA soldiers here too, watching from the side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's goin on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Acholi people were farmers before they were driven from their ancestral homeland. Each year they blessed the soil before a planting. And now the women begin to move in unison... singing an ancient Acholi song as one of the older orphan boys beats a small drum in accompaniment...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They are saying that fire brings strength and ashes abundance... The women continuing their dance... moving in a tight circle and stomping their feet as they sing...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... when the land burns, the next year the soil produces more... And now Betty peels away from the group and approaches Sam, talking to him directly in Arabic...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The children are your fields...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... she says you are a farmer and these children are your crops...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam looking to the 80 little orphans watching this from the side... and now Betty bends down and scoops up a bit of ashen earth and runs her finger across his forehead, blessing him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... and this ground will grow them tall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... and this ground is richer now and they will grow stronger because of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: standing here with his ashen face, staring at these people in front of him -- his African family.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Days later and we see Sam here with Nineteen and a few other SPLA soldiers, eating lunch, trying to learn their language. And it's humorous to these guys as Sam tries to pronounce some words in Arabic... And suddenly we hear YELLING coming from outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam coming out fast, sees soldiers pulling open the front gate as
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: pickup trucks speed into the compound -- SPLA military trucks - - skidding to a stop. Sam rushing over as soldiers help two YOUNG BOYS out of one of the trucks. Both are around 5 years old, injured and crying. And then a third child is lifted out in a makeshift stretcher -- this is ALICE - - 10 years old -- her broken body limp and bleeding profusely -- mumbling something to herself in Arabic over-and-over again -- INT. INFIRMARY - CHILDREN'S VILLAGE ORPHANAGE - DAY -- DOORS BANGING OPEN! -- CONTROLLED CHAOS as the children are hauled into this clinic -- Betty taking care of Alice -- the worst off -- hooking her up to an IV as Sam moves to her bedside -- the little girl still mumbling quietly -- SAM What is she saying?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She is asking what she did wrong? Sam taking Alice's hand in his... very slowly her beautiful eyes open and she sees him... and says something in Arabic...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She is asking if you are `The Preacher.'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell her she's gonna be ok. Betty translates and Alice smiles faintly... and now one of the other camp women comes over and Sam steps back so they can work...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam coming out of the infirmary and finding Deng here with a few of the SPLA soldiers who brought the children.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where did they find em?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Their village was hit out Adjumani. Off Sam, hearing this, we...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And we see Sam and Deng sitting outside the infirmary, exhausted, been here all night waiting. And now the door opens and Betty comes out. She looks down at them and simply shakes her head... And we know Alice is dead. And it looks like a grenade has gone off inside Sam. And suddenly he grabs an AK and gets up, seething, walks off...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Sam walking fast through the compound... Deng following...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are you going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adjumani.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam, please wait...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I ain't waitin. You wanna see what waitin gets ya? Take a look in that buildin over there... Sam reaching the SUV and starting to gear up...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the plaintive wail of an Acholi WAR SONG... haunting... ethereal... and then a chorus of voices rising up... taking us to...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bombing down this rutted, red dirt road. The engine at full tilt. Sam, Deng, Nineteen, Marco, and A.J. jammed into this truck riding in dead silence... AK47's bouncing between their knees... only the sound of the WAR SONG playing as we watch these men... a grave stillness on their faces... thinking of what men do just before their own death.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We see two LRA VEHICLES approaching in the distance... a LEAD JEEP and a PICKUP TRUCK behind it...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Four CHILD SOLDIERS squatting in the flatbed of this truck carrying AK47's. We recognize one of the boys as the younger brother from the opening scene -- WILLIAM.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With two ADULT REBELS in this Jeep as they drive down this road past bombed-out vehicles... and in the distance we see the smoldering wreckage of a transport truck on the side of the road... the thick smoke hanging over the road like a black curtain... blocking out vision of the road ahead... ... and the Jeep punches into the black smoke followed by the pickup truck... and we're lost in the swirling haze for a moment before coming out the other side... and this is what we see -- SAM -- standing in the middle of the road ahead of us shouldering a
direction.name: direction

result.heading: DAY THE PICKUP GRINDS TO A STOP

direction.raw_text: the ADULT REBELS see him just as -- WHOOOOSH! -- an RPG streaks right at us and DETONATES -- KABOOOOM! -- and the Jeep flips onto it's side -- INT. PICKUP TRUCK - DAY THE PICKUP GRINDS TO A STOP! -- the driver slamming it into REVERSE - - accelerating back into the curtain of smoke -- trying to get the fuck out of there when -- BBrrraaaappp! .30 CALIBER MACHINEGUN STRAFE across the front hood -- EXT. SUV - SAME -- and we see A.J. behind the .30 cal -- opening it up -- BBRAAAAAAPPP! -- BBRAAAAAPPP! -- blasting the engine compartment of the truck, trying to disable it -- 62 EXT. LRA PICKUP TRUCK - DAY -- the pickup truck reversing out of the black smoke -- OUT OF CONTROL -- going off the road into a ditch -- WILLIAM and the other boys bailing out of the flatbed -- TWO ADULT REBELS piling out of the cab -- scrambling for cover behind the truck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam, Deng, A.J. and the others hustling through the smoke and finding cover. From Sam's vantage point he sees rebels hiding behind the disabled truck for cover -- shooting back -- a withering firefight -- the big .30 cal ROARING offscreen but the truck is protecting the rebels -- no clear shot -- EXT. LRA TRANSPORT TRUCK - DAY William and the other child soldiers here with two ADULT REBELS -- crouched behind the truck for cover -- the ADULT REBELS returning fire, but the children aren't moving, scared shitless. William peers around the truck and sees Sam fifty yards away, turns to the boys next to him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's the white preacher! The other boys reacting, this means something to them. And now one of the ADULT REBEL turns to the children...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !!! And he pops up and returns fire, but the boys don't move.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: ADULT REBEL STAND UP AND FIGHT

direction.raw_text: running through the smoke toward Sam. He hits the ground and starts to screw an RPG into his launcher... he wants to hit the transport truck, but Sam shakes his head, waves him off...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No shot! There are children behind the truck! Marco hears this, ditches the RPG and picks up his AK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cover me! Marco laying down suppression fire as Sam sprints across the road -- advancing on the transport truck -- firing his AK from the hip -- bullets zinging past him -- he dives behind a berm and finds himself next to Deng. Neither man says a word as they jam fresh mags into their AK's, gunfire erupting all around them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LRA TRANSPORT TRUCK - DAY The adult rebels continue fighting -- alternately popping up from behind the truck and returning fire. The ADULT REBEL realizing that William and the other boys still aren't fighting -- ADULT REBEL Fight you cowards!!! But William and the other boys don't move, and the Adult Rebel keeps shooting until his mag clicks empty. He looks around and sees an RPG LAUNCHER on the ground, picks it up, arms it -- EXT. BERM - DAY Sam and Deng behind the berm. Sam peers over just as GUNFIRE misses him by inches. He drops back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't you just go home?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is not your war.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You leavin? Deng shakes his head -- SAM (CONT'D) Well then, I ain't leavin neither... Sam chambers a round, pivots around the berm as -- EXT. LRA TRANSPORT TRUCK - SAME -- the Adult Rebel stands up with the RPG -- fires! -- at the same instant William shoots him in the head -- he jerks -- WOOOOOSH! -- the missile launching at a bad angle as -- SAM COMES OUT FROM BEHIND THE BERM RPG streaking directly at him -- hitting the ground short -- BA-WHOOOM! -- AND OUR VISION EXPLODES TO WHITE For a long beat... only silence... and then slowly the white begins to fade... and we see Sam flat on his back... eyes blinking open... shell-shocked... staring up at blue sky... and then a shadow coming over him... someone stepping into his POV...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: it's William, hands held open in surrender, staring curiously at this strange white man laying in the dirt... and now Deng and Marco appear next to Sam and help him to his feet. And we see the battle is over. The remaining child soldiers slowly emerging from behind the LRA truck... laying down their weapons and walking toward Sam... joining William... staring at this white man in front of them... ... William reaches into his pocket and... ... Deng and Marco REACT -- lifting their AK's -- "Don't move! Don't move!" -- but the boy only pulls out a FADED PHOTOGRAPH... the one he grabbed just before his capture... a picture of him and his older brother... standing next to each other smiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you seen my brother?
direction.name: direction

result.heading: -- AND OUR VISION EXPLODES TO WHITE

direction.raw_text: children laying on the floor on reed mats, getting ready for sleep. And we find William in mid-conversation with a young boy named Anthony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Where are you from?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jabal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Were you with the rebels? Anthony nods. William pulls out his photograph.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you know my brother? He was called Christopher. Anthony studying the photograph...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He has a funny left eye. It looks the other way sometimes. Do you remember him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. William folding up the photograph, getting up, moving to another little boy a few feet away... kneeling next to him... and so he continues...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am William. Were you with the rebels?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . GENERATOR HUT - CHILDREN'S ORPHANAGE - NIGHT A soldier cuts off the generator and the compound goes black.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And we see Sam on his cot when the light goes out. He leans over and torches a small Kerosene lamp next to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The children on their mats in the dark now... quiet... a few of the younger ones whimpering, starting to cry... the darkness becoming too much... reminding them of past horrors... and then we hear a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: in this dark room... singing quietly... an ancient African lullaby... and then other little voices joining in... singing this song they all know... a song their mother's once sang to them...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Sam hearing the soft chorus drift across the compound... somehow finding comfort in it too... blowing out the lamp and laying here in the dark... listening to the children sing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... life springing up in the camp... daylight breaking... a routine seen here... Betty, Rose and the other camp women arriving at the orphanage... cooking fires being lit... soldiers drinking cups of strong coffee, warming themselves after a long night... ... and Sam coming out of his tukul carrying his duffle bag... discovering William curled up next to his door, sleeping on a mat in the dirt... been there all night. William stirring awake, seeing Sam above him and scrambling to his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mornin, buddy. William, no response. Just staring up at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ain't you gonna say nuthin? William, nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ok then. And Sam walks across the compound followed by William a few paces behind... and he reaches Deng, Betty, Nineteen, and a few of the other volunteers waiting by the truck...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks like you've got yourself a bodyguard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guess I do. Sam tosses his bag into the back, says goodbye to everyone...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take care of things while I'm gone, ok?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will, Preacher. They shake hands and Sam gets into the truck... and we see William already here, sitting in the backseat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't come with me, buddy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to William, Arabic) Get out of there. But William isn't moving...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on! -- out! -- ... and finally Deng reaches in and grabs him... tries to pull him out but he fights back... yelling as Deng drags him out of the truck...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam turning around in his seat as we pull away from the compound... and he sees William still struggling in Deng's arms... and finally he breaks free and SPRINTS for the truck as it drives off... fast as he can... chasing Sam until he no longer can.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . - DAY And we see two teens moving toward the sound of a crowd coming from inside the church, responsive, "Hallelujah!"... and then Sam's voice over it all...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) In your actions you give service to the Lord...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CHAPEL - SHEKINAH FELLOWSHIP CHURCH - CENTRAL CITY - SAME Sam at the pulpit in mid-sermon. There is an air of Fire and Brimstone to what we're watching here... electric... the congregation listening in rapt attention...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... he's not interested in your good thoughts... your good intentions... he wants your hands... your backs... your sweat... your blood to pour into the foundation that will build up his kingdom! Ad-libbed SHOUTS and PRAISE... and now we see Lynn, Daisy, Donnie and Paige in the congregation listening... as we go -- INT. HALLWAY/FOYER - SHEKINAH FELLOWSHIP CHURCH - DAY Lynn and Sam walking through the facility, and we see this place is alive with activity. More than just a church, this is a community center. Lynn opening a door and we see a Volunteer here with a dozen little children running around this playroom...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We started daycare last month. Monday thru Friday from 8 to 2... Sundays after first worship for a few hours if anybody needs it. How you doin, Sue?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good. Hey Pastor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sue. Lynn pulling the door closed and they continue... moving down a set of stairs to the basement where we see children and parents... some of them playing ping-pong and air hockey... others in a corner rehearsing for a Christmas play...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Been thinkin we need to put up a playground. Swings. Some things the kids can climb on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can't build anymore. Not for awhile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said Sundays has been full.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Turn outs been good, but that don't mean people is givin money. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Economy is in trouble, construction business is slow. Times is tight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Be good for them kids, Lynn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They got the playground over in Cairnbrook. And they can play at the school on weekends if they want Sam turning to her -- SAM Not talking bout here. Talkin about the orphange. Lynn catching up to him now, realizing his head is still back in Africa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam working on his Harley. Donnie entering in the b.g.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What'cha workin on, buddy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trouble with the push rods I think. She's runnin kinda rough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shoulda kept that mild in there `stead a buildin up a hot rod. Let's see whatcha got here... Donnie moving next to him, working on the bike...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... never had these problems when we was runnin solid lifters, huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Used to fix them old shovelheads on the side of the road with a buckknife and a wire hanger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Remember that year we went to the Freakers Ball? Sam smiling...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think that old `78 broke down five times on that trip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sounds about right. Shoot, we had more fun tryin to get there than when we finally did. Sam and Donnie share a laugh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I talk to you about somethin?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm glad I'm walkin with the Lord and all, but sometimes I ain't sure I'm gonna be able to do what he wants me to do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Lord don't ask for nuthin you can't deliver, buddy. And yer one tough ole boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sometimes I ain't so sure how tough I am. And we see in Donnie's eyes just how troubled he is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't we pray together then... And they both take a knee, bowing their heads as Sam continues...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Our gracious Heavenly Father, bless us with the strength to carry on in your name. And grant us, in our darkest hours, the understandin that you are always by our side. And we leave these two men, their heads bowed in quiet supplication, next to this Harley, praying for strength.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . - DAY (JULY/2004) Four or five gleaming sedans on this showroom floor. And we see Sam sitting across from BILL WALLACE, late 40's, gold Rolex.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... from what I heard, you built yourself one helluva church over there in Central City.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still got a ways to go, but we're gettin there. You should come on by one of these Sundays, bring the family.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's nice of you, but we're at Calvary now. Bit more our speed over there I think. Sam, getting down to business...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Reverand Carlton gives a mean sermon, puts me to shame. Anyway Bill, I'm here cause I wanna talk to you about what we're doin over there in Africa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Course I know about what you're doin. Helluva thing helpin out those kids, Sam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, but I'm gonna be straight with ya. We're hurtin for money... If we had a little bit more support from people like yourself sure would help things run a lot smoother over there. Bill feeling the rub, shaking his head...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam, look, everybody is feelin the pinch around here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hear that, but you gotta understand that them kids over there got nuthin. I mean nuthin, Bill, and I'm not asking for much.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much you lookin for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Five thousand dollars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus Christ, Sam! Five thousand dollars?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That keeps them doors open for another six months.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: People are losin their jobs left and right round here. Tough to be askin for five thousand dollars for a buncha African children half-way around the world. Sam shifting, not giving up, coming at him another way...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're right. We got problems right here. But with that kinda money we could feed them kids, house them kids. Bill staring at him, saying nothing, on the spot. Sam hoping that somehow he's reached this man. And finally Bill stands up...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright, tell you what, lemme see what I can do. Sam feeling this victory, flashing a smile, shaking Bill's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ok.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't you and the family come over to the house next Sunday. We're havin a little barbeque, ok?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sounds good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Upscale French provincial in suburban Johnstown. A "barbeque" is underway. 15 couples here with their kids and a handful of waiters in white-tie offering champagne and hors d'oeuvres to the guests.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and we see a perky woman in her late 40's coming through the crowd, blonde hair from a bottle, accessorized to the hilt, holding a glass of white wine. SHANNON WALLACE. She opens the door to find Sam, Lynn, and Paige standing in the doorway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, come on in... And they enter... Lynn smiling awkwardly, dressed in the same yellow dress we saw her in previously... her only dress... and Sam looking around this enormous room...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ya'll must be the Childers. Welcome. I'm Shannon, Bill's ball-n-chain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Smiling, a joke she loves...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm Lynn, this here is Sam, our daughter Paige.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good to meet you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) There he is! Everybody turning to see the car dealer coming through the crowd, smiling, a little drunk. AD-LIBBED introductions and then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Glad ya'll could make it. Get on in here and meet some people... Bill ushering them deeper into the house... quick intros to a few guests as they pass... Sam, Lynn, and Paige taking it all in... starting to sense the dimensions of this massive house... the waiters in their pressed jackets offering them food... the extravagance... like nothing they've ever seen... ... Bill pulling Sam off from the crowd so it's just the two of them... taking an envelope from his jacket and handing it to him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is a little somethin for the kids, ok? What we were talking about.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, Bill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forget it. Now c'mon, can I get ya a mojito or somethin?

direction.raw_text: As a mule. Garang smiling, an instant affinity for this man.

direction.raw_text: You are correct, but we must fight them at every level. Part of my battle is waged in those rooms. We must talk of peace, but keep our rifles ready for war. Sam turning to him, coming to an understanding here. Realizing that both of them are warriors in the same fight.

direction.raw_text: Ask you a question?

direction.raw_text: Yeah.

direction.raw_text: DAY - DAYS LATER We're hit by a crush of people, a thousand black faces moving past us and all the noise and confusion of this busy border town. And we find Sam, Deng, and Nineteen here loading supplies into the back of the SUV.

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) They talk about you... Sam turning to find Agnete, the aid worker, approaching him.

SAM'S TUKUL - CHILDREN'S ORPHANAGE - DUSK Sam sitting outside his tukul alone, tearing open an airmail package and pulling out another VIDEOCASSETTE, slides it into his videocamera, hits play -- ON THE SMALL SCREEN we see a school production... children dressed in costumes shuffling across the stage... lines being spoken by rote...and then the awkward entrance of Paige speaking her lines... but instead of finding joy in this sweet moment he finds heartache... the distance from his family... from their innocence... simply too great to bear in this moment... ... and then he hears giggling... and he realizes two young orphan
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Their dancing is terrible! The children laughing hysterically... and for an instant Sam is swept out of his melancholy by their sweet enjoyment... ... and then Sam sees Deng and Nineteen approaching quickly...

direction.raw_text: What's goin on?

direction.raw_text: That's where they sell em on the black market, ain't it?

direction.raw_text: A moonless night... and we see headlights piercing this blackness... bouncing down a singletrack road... we are...

direction.raw_text: . SAM'S TRUCK - DRIVING - NIGHT Deng behind the wheel driving -- Sam in the passenger seat -- Marco, Nineteen, and a third SPLA SOLDIER jammed in the back -- DENG Look... Far ahead we see three sets of HEADLIGHTS coming towards us on the road -- just bouncing white dots on the horizon -- and silently they begin to check their mags and weapons -- preparing for battle -- -- and the headlights get closer -- Deng not slowing down -- and we realize we are on a collision course with this convoy -- and finally we see MUZZLE FLASHES in the distance -- and -- THUNK!, THUNK!, THUNK! Machine gun strafe hitting the front and side of the truck -- SAM Let's go! Sam and Nineteen leaning through the open windows as Deng drives -- leveling their AK's and firing -- KRAKAKAKAKAK! KRAKAKAKAKAK! And now the approaching convoy LIGHTS UP with RETURN FIRE! -- Sam and Nineteen hanging out the windows blasting back -- Deng stepping on the gas, accelerating toward the convoy like some hellish game of "chicken"(reminiscent of Sam and Donnie's wild ride with the Drifter in scene #29) -- -- and we watch as the headlights barrel towards us at full bore -- BULLETS POPPING across the windshield of the truck -- SAM AND NINETEEN IN CONSTANT FIRE MODE -- THE SOUND DEAFENING -- headlights blown out on both trucks and now we're plunged into total blackness - - only the wild-strobe of machine gun fire lighting up the night as these trucks slam towards each other -- and finally -- THE LRA CONVOY CAREENS OFF THE ROAD AND BOTTOMS OUT IN A DITCH Deng skidding to a stop as Sam, Nineteen, and the third SPLA SOLDIER pile out of the truck -- firing and advancing on the caravan by foot.

Marco hustling up with a spotlight -- Sam switching it on as Deng rips the canvas back and we see -- TWENTY THREE CHILDREN IN THE BACK OF THIS TRANSPORT TRUCK Boys and girls... none of them older than twelve... tied together with rope... emaciated... terrified... in very bad shape.
