A firestorm of lead -- Sam, Deng, and the rest of his team coming onto the bridge shooting -- rebels scrambling for cover but it's too late -- dropping as they try and sprint away -- and in an instant it's all over. Agnete sees Sam, rushes toward him, but when he looks at her she freezes. He is completely unrecognizable to her in this moment -- a killer's thousand-yard stare -- barely human -- more like a machine than a man. And he moves past her down the bridge, to the LRA LEADER on the ground who is still alive. And he puts the barrel of his rifle against the rebel's head and...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! He's dead. Just like that. And he continues walking up the bridge. And we see Agnete, Deng and the other soldiers having just witnessed this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: William coming in quietly, moving next to one of the captured Rebels from the previous scene who is shackled to a bed, injured. Two SPLA soldiers here standing guard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to ask you something... William pulls out the photograph of his brother, holds it up...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is my brother. His name is Christopher. He was stolen by the rebels. (BEAT) Do you know if he is alive? The Rebel looks at the photograph but says nothing, just shakes his head... and he looks off, his thousand yard stare inscrutable... And William simply folds the photograph back up and slips it into his pocket... but he doesn't leave... he sits here a moment longer... quietly... thinking... and then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Were you taken when you were young like me? The Rebel hears this and turns to him... and nods his head...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you remember your parents? And we see something happening in this hardened rebel... his eyes filling with a distant memory... a sadness... and slowly he nods his head again. And we stay here with these two lost souls sitting next to each other... silent... connected by a shared history and anguish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DAY - LATER Sam sitting alone, lost to the world around him. Deng approaches. Neither one acknowledging the other for a long beat until...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you hear that, Preacher?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is no more laughter. The children do not play here anymore. They are scared once again. (BEAT) But now they are scared of you. Sam, no response.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The men do not trust you any longer to lead them into battle. They say you have a wish to die. (BEAT) I am worried about my friend. I want to help him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't need your help. And Sam turns away. After a beat Deng walks off, leaving him alone once again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And we see Sam here in the dark... moonlight filtering in through the thatched roof... like shards of glass cutting through the blackness... and he doesn't look right here... soul worn thin... eyes hollow... starting to go someplace very bad...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... IMAGES FLASHING IN HIS HEAD... babies burned and screaming... Donnie in his coffin... and we realize we're watching something here... his world starting to cave in on him... ... and he drops against his cot... distraught... tears in his eyes and this man is breaking... and suddenly we see a gun in his hand... finger curling around the trigger as he puts it to his head... eyes closing against the world... and...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam frozen... still holding the gun... and slowly the door pushes open and we hear soft footsteps shuffling into this dark room... ... and William steps into the light, sees Sam here on the ground with the gun in his hand... and slowly he moves next to him, sitting on the cot without saying a word... just the two of them here for a moment... and then slowly he begins in perfect English...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I remember my parents when I sleep. I see them in my dreams sometimes. Sam looking to William... this small boy sitting above him... telling his story...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My father was big like you. They shot him. We were so scared. Then the rebels gave me a club and told me if I didn't kill my mother they would shoot my brother and me. And William pauses in his story... lost in this memory... his face becoming a mask of pain... but no tears... there are no more tears in this young man left to be shed... and so he continues...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I refused, but my mother told me to swing hard... that I must make her proud... (BEAT) And so I did. I made her proud. And now William looks down at Sam... staring at this man on the ground... and he reaches out and gently touches Sam's head... a moment of tenderness for both of them... an act of love.... these two broken souls finding each another here... and William says...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If we allow ourselves to become full of hate then they've won. We must not let them take our hearts. This is the most important thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And Sam sets the gun down and reaches out to William, pulls him into an embrace... holding him close... and we know that without a doubt this boy has saved this man's life.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: WE HEAR A KNOCK AT HIS DOOR

direction.raw_text: . - NIGHT Soft Christian music is playing on the radio. Lynn folding clothes in the laundry room when the phone rings. Paige comes into the upstairs hallway and answers it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (quiet, into phone) Hello?
direction.name: direction

result.heading: INT.
location: CHILDERS' HOUSE UPSTAIRS HALLWAY- CENTRAL CITY, PENN

direction.raw_text: Sam on his sat phone -- SAM Bug? You there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . - NIGHT PAIGE Dad?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, it's me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You ok?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm ok, Bug. And there's a long pause... so much to say but no words to say it... each of them holding their phones to their ears and just listening... and finally Sam says...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm thinkin of a tree... And we see tears well up in Paige's eyes when she hears this... and now we see Lynn coming around the corner, overhearing them as they begin their little game one more time...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said tree... I'm thinkin of a knee. Sam smiling to himself... and we realize this man is coming back to life when he says...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said knee, I'm thinkin of bee... (BEAT) I love you, Bug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love you too, Daddy. Lynn hearing this and tears roll down her cheeks as we go...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And we see the soldiers at their posts... Betty and the other Camp Women cleaning clothes and preparing food... and we see most of the children loitering around a tree in the shade, sullen, not playing on the playground. And then we see Sam coming into the courtyard kicking a soccer ball... some of the children see him and point... and slowly the entire camp begins to notice Sam kicking the soccer ball awkwardly by himself out in the open... Betty and the other women stopping their chores and watching him, speaking to one another in Arabic... Deng and the other soldiers staring as Sam pops the ball into the air and bounces it off his head... ... and now a couple of the smaller kids sprint for him and he kicks them the ball... and slowly the rest of the children join in the fun... kicking the ball back and forth... an impromptu soccer game... and then we hear LAUGHTER again... joy flooding back into this place. Deng watching with a big smile as this white man dances around these little children... a Pied Piper of joy... playing in the dirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DAY - LATER And we see William approach a knot of soldiers standing by the front gate smoking cigarettes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is it true an LRA commander was captured last night? Soldiers nodding their heads "yes."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where is he being held?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At the army base in Kisoro.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you going there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I ride with you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why do you want to go to Kisoro?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to ask the commander something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, you cannot ride with us. Wait till tomorrow and go with the women on the bus. And the soldiers turn their backs on William and he slinks away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We see a line of women along the riverbank in their colorful dresses... scrubbing pans and washing clothes... singing an ancient African spiritual as they work... the sun dropping pale red on the horizon... And we see Sam here too... alone with himself... sitting at the river's edge, watching the water rolling gently past... listening to the soft serenade of the women... the beauty of it all... ... and then he gets up and walks into the river... and he kneels down so that water reaches his waist (reminiscent of his first baptism in scene #35)... and now the women on the riverbank stop their work, watching him as he closes his eyes and gently leans back... submitting to the water... and when he comes up again we see in his eyes that his soul has been saved in this simple act. And the women begin to shout their praise from the riverbank as we go...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And we see William here alone, pulling out a small satchel... filling it with a bottle of water and a blanket...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: William at the edge of the compound... looking over his shoulder to make sure nobody is watching him... and then quickly slipping under the fence and he's gone...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: William walking through the dry scrub alone... already a couple miles deep in the bush... the sun starting to set... light waning... William starting to get nervous, picking up his pace...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A squad of LRA rebels coming through the scrub... William hiding under a bush, terrified... the men coming closer... no idea if they saw him or not... his mind racing... voices getting louder... starting to hyper-ventilate from the fear -- and -- WILLIAM BOLTS Sprinting through the bush -- running for his life -- rebels see him
direction.name: direction

result.heading: 114 AND THEN THE SOUND OF MEN

direction.raw_text: yelling for him to stop -- chasing him down -- shooting their rifles into the air and he hits the ground in the fetal position -- too terrified to continue -- eyes clamped shut as 4 or 5 rebels surround him -- guns pointed at his head -- caught.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam coming into the building, finding Betty tending to a sick child.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you seen William? Betty shaking her head "no", and we see the worry on Sam's face... intuitively knows something is wrong.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: William bound and gagged being dragged through the bush by 5 or 6 rebels... and one of the rebels sees him staring at them and he brings the butt of his Kalishnikov down hard -- striking William on the head as we go -- EXT. OFFICE - CHILDREN'S ORPHANAGE - DUSK Deng coming up to Sam...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some of the soldiers said he was asking about the commander that is being held at Kismoro. Sam closing his eyes, knows instantly what William has done.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get em on the phone, see if he's shown up at the base yet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: William shoved through the bush... moving deeper into this rebel encampment... dark and otherworldly... figures moving around camp fires... laughing... men with little girls... their child wives... with pregnant bellies... and incongruously the sound of American rap music coming from a jambox somewhere. The overriding sense we get from this place is one of `insanity.'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And William is dragged to a clearing next to a grouping of tents and he's kicked to the dirt... two other soldiers pinning him to the ground as a third grabs his feet and pulls off his shoes... William
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and now a handful of other LRA soldiers start to gather around... most of them only a few years older than him... watching as his ankles are bound together and placed on a wooden block... ... and now another soldier steps forward with an AXE... and the crowd whips into bloodlust... shouting... cheering...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) (ARABIC) Stop! The soldier freezes -- everyone turning as an LRA COMMANDER comes through the crowd -- takes the axe from the soldier -- SOLDIER He ran from us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is worth nothing with no feet. Put him with the others until tomorrow.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: AND THE SOLDIER LIFTS THE AXE INTO THE AIR -- WILLIAM WRITHING ON THE GROUND BUT CAN'T GET FREE -- AND THE SOLDIER STARTS TO BRING THE BLADE DOWN -- AND -- VOICE

direction.raw_text: Deng hustling up to Sam... shaking his head...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They have not see the boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ok. Get Nineteen and Marco -- we're gonna go look for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And we see William in a bamboo cell in the center of camp... and we see other children here... in various stages of fear and suffering... some of them completely naked... shivering in the cool air... others catatonic, probably doped up or too battered to move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam, Deng, Nineteen and Marco in this lead truck... been out here for hours... behind them we see the second camp truck following... And they come to a fork in the road, pulling to a stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It will be light soon. What do you want to do? Sam looking at a topo map on his lap...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go through Maridi, see if they've seen anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pale yellow sun breaking and we see William and a line of 10 or 12 other children -- shackled in iron -- being loaded into the back of a TRANSPORT TRUCK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Both SUV's parked off the side of the road now. Sam and Deng here, looking at maps and the GPS tracker. And we hear Deng's radio squawk. He digs it out, responds in Arabic, then turns to Sam...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The village outside of Akot says an LRA caravan came through there an hour ago. They were headed for Ed Duim.
direction.name: direction

result.ToD: -- TWO ROOSTER-TAILS OF DUST COMING AT US
result.heading: -- TWO ROOSTER-TAILS OF DUST COMING AT US

direction.raw_text: A convoy of 4 or 5 LRA trucks barreling down this dirt track. And we see lots of rebels standing up in the back of these trucks, cradling heavy weapons, alert -- and suddenly we see in the distance -- TWO ROOSTER-TAILS OF DUST COMING AT US From different angles -- converging on the LRA convoy -- the Rebels see them and point -- they know what's coming and they begin to prepare for war -- THE ROOSTER-TAILS Getting closer -- and then we see them -- SAM'S TWO TRUCKS Bouncing over the terrain towards us -- coming fast -- and then -- WOOOOSH! An RPG streaks toward the lead LRA truck and -- KABOOOM! -- the truck is blown off it's axles -- the other LRA trucks pulling off the road -- and suddenly we're in a withering firefight -- the roar of heavy weapons at full-tilt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jumping out of their trucks and flanking the LRA convoy -- triangulating fire -- shredding the rebels -- blowing them back off their feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sprinting through the bush -- edging around the LRA trucks -- finding a position on their weak side and locking an RPG into a launcher -- shouldering it -- aiming -- WOOOOSH! -- the missile streaking toward the second LRA jeep and -- KABOOOM! It's blasted into the air -- onto it's side -- rebels scurrying away from the wreckage -- still firing -- an absolute hail of lead -- AK's barking in every direction -- KRATAKRATAKRATAKRATAKRAKKK! One of the rebels standing up -- firing an RPG -- WOOOOOSH!
direction.name: direction

result.heading: -- THE TRUCK IS EVISCERATED IN THE BLAST

direction.raw_text: crouched behind the new orphanage truck firing -- sees the white streak coming at him -- dives -- just as -- THE TRUCK IS EVISCERATED IN THE BLAST!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: moving closer to the rebels -- shooting -- picking them off one by one -- gunfire raking over his head -- a dozen muzzle flashes coming from everywhere -- Sam yelling over the thunder -- SAM Go! -- Go! -- Go! -- Go! And we see Deng coming out of the bush to his right -- and then Nineteen to his left -- and they charge on the remaining rebels -- Sam providing covering fire -- a curtain of lead cutting through the enemy -- and just like that it's over -- Sam waving behind him -- SAM (CONT'D) Cease fire!!
direction.name: direction

result.heading: -- 50 CHILDREN CRAMMED INTO THE BACK OF THIS TRUCK SAM, (CONT'D)

direction.raw_text: and suddenly there's just a sick silence -- smoke rising from the shot-to-shit LRA trucks -- bodies strewn in the dirt -- the brand new orphanage truck bombed out and smoking on it's side. And Sam makes his way to the first TRANSPORT TRUCK -- Deng covering him as he rips the canvas back to see -- 50 CHILDREN CRAMMED INTO THE BACK OF THIS TRUCK SAM (CONT'D) Pull em all out! C'mon, let's go!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Soldiers, Arabic) Take them out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Soldiers start to unload the children -- SAM Cut them loose!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to soldier, Arabic) Cut the ropes! Sam moves to the second TRANSPORT TRUCK, rips the canvas back to
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holy fuck indeed. He's been here before... 100 kids and he only has one good vehicle... and we watch him standing here... staring at these tiny faces looking back at him... a moment... lost in indecision until one of the kids stands up near the back...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam sees him and suddenly he knows exactly what he needs to do...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !... get em out of there and line em up! -- C'MON! -- And we've seen this before... Sam going through these children... assessing their health... one by one... separating the worse off from the others... forming two group... turning to Deng and Nineteen and motioning to the smaller group (about 15 children)...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Load these here into the truck. Put em three deep if you have to... Deng herding the children toward the one good truck...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (turning to Marco, Arabic) Come with me -- NEW ANGLE Sam and Marco moving from one dead LRA rebel to the other... rolling them onto their backs... going through their belts... pulling out extra ammo clips and grenades...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get them AK's too. (ARABIC) The machine guns. Marco swinging four or five machine guns onto his shoulder...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At the SUV, now jammed with children. Sam talking to Nineteen, Marco and the others...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need all you to climb up on that roof and keep yer eyes peeled. That road back might be hot, so be ready.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about you, Preacher?
direction.name: direction

result.heading: FIND -- 50 MORE CHILDREN SHACKLED IN THE BACK OF THIS TRUCK

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) We're staying. Sam turns to see Deng next to him, holding an AK in his hands, a steely resolve in his eyes. Sam nods, emboldened by his support.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to the soldiers) Go on. Get outta here. The soldiers load onto the SUV and drive off, leaving Sam and Deng standing here in the middle of these 85 children. Waiting for the war that will surely come.
direction.name: direction
